Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll
public class CourseRoll extends Object
CourseRoll is a class that encapsulates information about students in a class. More specifically it maintains a list of students in a class, and keeps track of adding/removing students from that roll.
Author:
Jeremiah Knizley, Spencer Grattan

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseRoll

      public CourseRoll(Course course, int enrollmentCapacity)
      Constructor for CourseRoll, creates the list of students on the roll, sets the capacity using the parameter
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCapacity - the capacity of students that can be added to the roll
      course - the course associated with this roll
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if course is null

  • Method Details

    • setEnrollmentCap

      public void setEnrollmentCap(int enrollmentCapacity)
      sets the enrollment capacity.
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCapacity - the capacity of students that can be added to the CourseRoll
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCapacity is less than MIN_ENROLLMENT or greater than MAX_ENROLLMENT

    • getOpenSeats

      public int getOpenSeats()
      returns the number of open seats.
      Returns:
      int the number of open seats (enrollmentCap minus the current size of the roll).

    • getEnrollmentCap

      public int getEnrollmentCap()
      returns the enrollmentCap
      Returns:
      int the enrollmentCap

    • enroll

      public void enroll(Student s)
      Enrolls the passed student by adding it to the end of the roll
      Parameters:
      s - the student to enroll
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the student is null, there is no more room in the class, the student is already enrolled, adding the student to the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception and wait list is full

    • drop

      public void drop(Student s)
      Drops the passed student from the course by removing it from the roll
      Parameters:
      s - the student to drop from the course
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the student is null if removing the student from the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception

    • getNumberOnWaitlist

      public int getNumberOnWaitlist()
      Returns the number of students currently on the wait list for a course
      Returns:
      int the number of students on the wait list for a course

    • canEnroll

      public boolean canEnroll(Student s)
      Helper method to check if a student can be added to the course roll
      Parameters:
      s - the student being enrolled
      Returns:
      true if the student can be added to the course roll false if there is no more room in the class or if the student is already enrolled
